title: Cigotuvi's Dreadful Rot
data:
***Obsolete**: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.*

| [![Cigotuvi's dreadful rot.png](/images/6/64/Cigotuvi%27s_dreadful_rot.png)](/File:Cigotuvi%27s_dreadful_rot.png) Cigotuvi's Dreadful Rot |                                                                                                                |
| :---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Level                                                                                                                                     | 2                                                                                                              |
| School1                                                                                                                                   | [Air](/Air_Magic "Air Magic")                                                                                  |
| School2                                                                                                                                   | [Alchemy](/Alchemy "Alchemy")                                                                                  |
| School3                                                                                                                                   | [Necromancy](/Necromancy "Necromancy")                                                                         |
| Source(s)                                                                                                                                 | [Book of Decay](/Book_of_Decay "Book of Decay") [Trismegistus Codex](/Trismegistus_Codex "Trismegistus Codex") |
| [Casting noise](/Spell_noise "Spell noise")                                                                                               | 2                                                                                                              |
| [Spell noise](/Spell_noise "Spell noise")                                                                                                 | 0                                                                                                              |
| Power Cap                                                                                                                                 | 100                                                                                                            |
| Flags                                                                                                                                     | Unclean                                                                                                        |

**Cigotuvi's Dreadful Rot** was a level 2 [Necromancy](/Necromancy "Necromancy")/[Air Magic](/Air_Magic "Air Magic")/[Poison Magic](/Poison_Magic "Poison Magic") spell which created a cloud of [miasma](/Miasma "Miasma") on your tile.

[Hedge Wizards](/Hedge_Wizard "Hedge Wizard") started with this spell in their libraries.

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [2.1 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [3 History](#History)
- [4 References](#References)

## Useful Info

Creates a [cloud](/Cloud "Cloud") of [miasma](/Miasma "Miasma") on the user's tile. This slows, heavily poisons, and damages most creatures that step inside. [Undead](/Undead "Undead") and [nonliving](/Nonliving "Nonliving") monsters are unaffected, as are those with miasma resistance. You are immune to this cloud while you cast this spell, however you must immediately move out of the cloud to avoid suffering its effects.

Each cast [drains](/Drain "Drain") about 9% of the player's max [HP](/HP "HP"), which can be restored by earning [XP](/XP "XP").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Strategy

Most monsters in the early game won't willingly walk through the miasma cloud. In a hallway, you can create a cloud, then attack behind it for a few turns. It can also be used to escape foes, if used in a hallway.

### Tips & Tricks

- Works well with [Mephitic Cloud](/Mephitic_Cloud "Mephitic Cloud"), as [confused](/Confused "Confused") monsters can fall into the cloud. Can also be combined with [Lesser Beckoning](/Lesser_Beckoning "Lesser Beckoning") or a [potion of attraction](/Potion_of_attraction "Potion of attraction") for the same result.
- [Undead](/Undead "Undead") and [nonliving](/Nonliving "Nonliving") monsters are unaffected by miasma. Also watch out for monsters with ranged attacks

## History

- Removed in [0.32](/0.32 "0.32") and replaced by the level 4 spell [Cigotuvi's Putrefaction](/Cigotuvi%27s_Putrefaction "Cigotuvi's Putrefaction"). [Hedge Wizards](/Hedge_Wizard "Hedge Wizard") now start with the new spell [Grave Claw](/Grave_Claw "Grave Claw") instead.
- This spell was added in [0.30](/0.30 "0.30"), replacing both [Corpse Rot](/Corpse_Rot "Corpse Rot") and [Conjure Flame](/Conjure_Flame "Conjure Flame").

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [spl-clouds.cc:48](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.30.0/crawl-ref/source/spl-clouds.cc#L48) (0.30.0)

Cigotuvi's Dreadful Rot

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.
 Cigotuvi's Dreadful Rot
Level 2
School1 Air
School2 Alchemy
School3 Necromancy
Source(s)

Book of Decay
Trismegistus Codex

Casting noise 2
Spell noise 0
Power Cap 100
Flags Unclean

Cigotuvi's Dreadful Rot was a level 2 Necromancy/Air Magic/Poison Magic spell which created a cloud of miasma on your tile.

Hedge Wizards started with this spell in their libraries.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Strategy
    • 2.1 Tips & Tricks
  • 3 History
  • 4 References

Useful Info

Creates a cloud of miasma on the user's tile. This slows, heavily poisons, and damages most creatures that step inside. Undead and nonliving monsters are unaffected, as are those with miasma resistance. You are immune to this cloud while you cast this spell, however you must immediately move out of the cloud to avoid suffering its effects.

Each cast drains about 9% of the player's max HP, which can be restored by earning XP.[1]

Strategy

Most monsters in the early game won't willingly walk through the miasma cloud. In a hallway, you can create a cloud, then attack behind it for a few turns. It can also be used to escape foes, if used in a hallway.

Tips & Tricks

  • Works well with Mephitic Cloud, as confused monsters can fall into the cloud. Can also be combined with Lesser Beckoning or a potion of attraction for the same result.
  • Undead and nonliving monsters are unaffected by miasma. Also watch out for monsters with ranged attacks

History

  • Removed in 0.32 and replaced by the level 4 spell Cigotuvi's Putrefaction. Hedge Wizards now start with the new spell Grave Claw instead.
  • This spell was added in 0.30, replacing both Corpse Rot and Conjure Flame.

References

  1. ↑ spl-clouds.cc:48 (0.30.0)
